comments.body: It can act as a extended tripwire or other method

Or even just make TRIPWIRE HOOKS a little more convenient to use, by having its singal increased to the block they are attached to.

Right now it‚Äôs very very clunky to make a door with hooks and string. It‚Äôs still 100 million times easier to just put a pressure plate down.
Is that not just the already existing Minecraft observer? if there are more details to this request I'd be interested to know what it would be.
This suggestrion is redundant, you can make such a sensor using redstone ore and observer or puffer fish and a pressure plate.
i like it!
Yay! üòÅ
It would be even better if they added powered minecarts to bedrock

I actually want to include the BUD-switch Solution in the post but it will againts the rules in the feedback site, so i made them separately.

üåü Feel free to check in here :

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360075410051-The-Third-Fourth-Pistons-BUD-Pistons-solution-for-Java-and-Bedrock-

I know there're so much holes in the explanation, so here're some details for it : üåü

‚Ä¢ Only the coated side will recieve the Quasi-Connectivity power (you can coat all sides if you want, so it'll be quasy-connected from all sides)

‚Ä¢ I said it before but, not only pistons, you can also Quasi-connect other "active" redstone components like Dropper, Dispenser, and Note block ( with that, if you smart and extreme enough, you can power in total, 13 pistons, or dispensers, or droppers, or note blocks at the same time )

= Those works because the coated side of the component will accept even a "soft" redstone power ( even a soft-powered air_block ). Say you powered a block with a piston placed next to it, and then you want to add another piston next to the first piston but want it to get powered too. You can just coat the side of the second piston that will be connected to the first piston, and boom, the second piston will get powered too (this feature will be very useful in so much redstone contaption)

‚Ä¢ Soft-Powered Coated Redstone Components won't Power another Redstone Components

‚Ä¢ What is a Soft Redstone Power? Say you powered a block and placed a piston next to it, the piston will get activated, it's because the piston got the Medium Redstone Power from the block. But if you placed a second piston next to the the first one, the second one will only recieve a Soft Redstone Power from the first piston and won't get activated (it'll only active with QC which bedrock didn't have yet)

Each item could have diffrent weights depending on the real life properties.  All of the mobs should also have different weights to.  So like you could build a system so it is like Villager go in, but not zombies!
no es mala idea

I thing the best way to execute this is to treat the players inventory as if there was a comparator taking an output from it and to have the new item give out different signal strengths depending on how full their inventory is. Not a bad idea overall
ya hay una placa de presi√≥n por peso

This is a great idea. It would allow for so much more depth and filtering when using Sculk Sensors in redstone contraptions. The different vibrations would give off different redstone signal strengths so you could activate different things with them.
We pretty much got this but better with the comparator output for sculk sensors in 20w49a, so I think this suggestion can be marked as done.
Furnace minecart needs an upgrade. The fuel is the beginning.
Please bring furnace minecart to bedrock

It needs to have lava buckets for fuel, chains to link them together, some debugging, and to brought to bedrock. But it is a very cool feature, and for a game called "Minecraft" it should definitely have these.
Maybe the crafting recipe could be redstone, comparator and beehive?

I totally agree with this as it is very hard for me to detect whether there are bees inside of the nest when I silk touch it, and when I go to my base I am utterly disappointed as there is nothing inside.

If you put a trapdoor in front of a bee hive bees can return to the hive but not leave
If you use a piston to put a trapdoor in front then wait a little all bees would be inside

I dont like the idea of a redstone component to only do this one job as redstone is about using basic components and brain power to achive cool things
I agree!!! We really need our creations to stop just trashing themselves when the chunk loads. IT SUCKS
this has to be in game... chunk loader or something
The problem with player induced chunk loading is that it will allow players to pretty much DDoS the servers by loading too many chunks.
Maybe have some functionality for minecarts or a type of minecart that has a chunkloading property? Like a new use for furnace minecarts or something?

In Quark mod there are colored slime blocks as well, but they went even further:

"Slime blocks can be dyed Red and Blue. The primary color blocks (Red, Green, and Blue) can be combined to create secondary colors (Cyan, Magenta, and Yellow).

While being moved by pistons, two slime blocks will only connect if they're the same color, or if one is made of another (so Red won't connect to Blue, but it'll connect to Magenta). Any color of slime will connect to non-slime blocks around it normally."

Link: https://quark.vazkii.net/ 

Also "normal" (green) slime block could stick to all other colors.

 

Similar functionality have Half Slimeblocks (Redstone ++ mod)

  • Behaves like a Slime Block on one side, and like a normal Block on the other. The remaining 4 side are "sorta" sticky.
  • When pushed by a piston, blocks will stick to the all-slime side, but not the all-stone side. Only Slime Blocks and Half Slime Blocks will stick to the sorta sticky sides.
  • Can be placed in any direction.

Link: https://www.curseforge.com/minecraft/mc-mods/redstoneplusplus 

Link to MumboJumbo¬¥s video about half slimeblocks: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=arERtfrUHqI

I love this idea but I'd change it to make all slime block colours stick to the normal slime block.

I think this (- Colored slime-blocks connect to blocks of the same color) is a terrible idea.

And 386254784992 I don't really like the way quark does coloured slime blocks I prefer SethBling's way of doing it.
This has been implemented in the form of honey blocks

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.

This sounds like some of that could be used but a lot of things we already can be fully automated or almost fully automated, although the blueprint idea sounds like a nice addition but I think in that case it may still be a bit too op in itself if it built itself instantly out of nowhere and just takes the resources from your inventory to do so, I think it should at least make you do some of the work
Would be also cool to place a hopper upside down in the water on a barrel.  So when you dig sand blocks ore kelp... it will go up straight into the hopper into the barrel.
I vote! It would be easier to use than droppers. Plus it's fun to watch people placing hoppers in the wrong direction and breaking their entire redstone contraption!
Or sideways!
they need to be powerd else they are illegal
I have some PE redstone creations that rely on the concept of redstone facing all four ways when placed.  Please keep it that way.

Both editions function the same. The dot still powers in all directions. It will messes up builders who like to use it as decoration but I personally think it is better to have it look the way it acts, and not have the dot.

the 1.16 change is perfect for bedrock
i agree
there should be 2 hoppers one down one up they can connect to
it could be a hopper recipe but it needs a bucket of water (like the water pushes it up)
I wouldn't have it simply rotate but swap through various directions based upon what it can connect to
I'm guessing you mean, like, a regular rail changing between being curved and being straight?
Maybe right click to rotate and control + right click to curve/straighten the rail.
you know you can already do that by placing a powered switch next to it right?
Couldn't people just place a redstone torch and open the chest? I don't really see the point for this...
Same crafting recipe but with gold instead of iron, the gold hopper UI would have two slots, one for the item you want to sort and another that can contain a stack of the item that passes through.

Ok I know what your going for but you may have better luck rewording the description.

potential recipe description may help:

Iron Hopper in the middle crafting slot

5 gold in the the shape of a V

(To try and keep it balanced with the game) 2 redstone dusts in the bottom two  corners.

and the item you want filtered above the iron hopper

I see this being hard to implement though with how your wanting it to only filter with what it is made using. maybe easier to say go look at the golden Hopper mod in forge and add it. As that would be a balanced recipe and less complicated in coding since it can only filter what is in the filter slot and the rest of the slot work for overflow. Still having a way to up grad hoppers for filtering would be nice.
I had the same idea, especially since the new mountains update give more variation in temperate and warm climates.

It should be where temperature underground aside from altitude spanning pockets of water, pockets of lava, and areas open to surface vary little except by depth and how much material is between one and the surface or in otherwords how deep one is and how much extra material from such things as mountains and hills there is between one and the surface.
You do realize there a circuit called a redstone torch line.

While an interesting idea I do not see how this could be easily implemented.  To cycle through all the possible orientations for a piece of redstone dust you would have to cycle through; 4 different layouts and 4 different positions for each meaning the pickaxe would need to cycle through at least 16 different combinations.  Or the hitbox for redstone dust would need to be completely redone.
I think redstone pipes that act exactly like normal redstone but don‚Äôt get affected by water would be a better idea to add.
soggystone ore should only spawn underwater
I was also thinking of this :D. Maybe normal redstone should change to soggy redstone when in water.
How do you make it or do you get it from a ore?
I think Redstone pipes would be better so they would be Redstone combined with stone for the pipe
A good Idea I hope they will add this

Or make a toggle switch on the hopper that lets you change behavior from unloading traditionally (left to right) to how you propose (First in, last out). You could even have an option to make them unload oldest items first (first in first out.)

I love this idea, but I think a cross-shaped menu is far better. One where you can change what sides the hopper‚Äôs pipes go into, with a maximum of 5 active pipes (4 on sides, 1 on bottom). They should be color coded to know the sides. Thinking about it now, it might as well become a new block because it‚Äôs just an item filter. Very nice though; I‚Äôve been waiting since 2014 to see an item filter be added.
Excellent idea.
Slime blocks should add vibrato and snow layers should also have a muffle effect

yes! seems unfair the majority playerbase cannot have such cool features.

redstone is the biggest parity issue by far. and as a technical player myself (not very good, just some simple farms and maybe a redstone cipher for a map) i would love to see things like sugar cane farms running 24/7

I think that if it is to be added it must necessarily be obtained from the end, perhaps from ships, or with some recipe that requires end materials. One thing I could say is that this block might work well when they finally decide to update the end.
Probably with a new ore that feels like it's flying, or, this object could be made to be a core of flying platforms or something similar that spawns and flies through the air.
I think it has to be a block that takes more effort to get due to it being very OP, or it can be limited more so that it can be easier to get.
Obviously, adding a block like this requires a lot more than what was done on April Fools' Day, since there are tons of bugs to fix, but it would be very nice.
Another thing that I would really like if this block is added would be to add a special block or an object that, if used on a common block, no longer makes it attach to the flotator machine, so a simple solution can be found to the fact which is catastrophic if you make a mistake with a flotator machine.
Oh, last idea: a block with which you can interact even in a state of movement with the flotator, which when activated, stops all the flotators in the machine, only if they do not make it possible to interact with levers while they are moving, and which the flotator, go and check, always moving, that it is activated by the redstone. I think the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãthe block turning off all the flotators is easier to implement.

I think even if its just introduced with commands for mapmakers for now it would already be a great feature to have. And it promises a lot of possibilities. I think it has similar transformative potential to the crafter, but it might take a while to balance before introducing it to the vanilla game
I want this block. It's awesome. Maybe we choose which blocks stick to it by sliming them like we wax copper?
